actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to provide that the operation of pay television systems shall be licensed by the Federal Communications Commission.

summary.text: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to set forth provisions for the licensing of pay television stations by the Federal Communications Commission. States that the maximum term of a license granted under this Act shall be three years, renewable for an additional three year term. Enumerates restrictions on the program material which a pay television license may transmit.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to provide that the operation of pay television systems shall be licensed by the Federal Communications Commission.
